intro: Hemerocallis lilioasphodelus var. yezoensis, commonly known as the Yezo daylily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Japan. It features upright, sword-shaped leaves and produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow to orange. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, with each flower lasting only one day. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. This variety is noted for its hardiness and ability to naturalize in suitable climates.
